DOC.brief_summary: Is PET-CT scan better than PET or CT alone in diagnosing primary tumours in patients with unknown primary tumors? Can information obtained with PET-CT replace other clinical and radiological investigations? Is PET/CT cost-effective?
DOC.brief_title: Positron Emission Tomography - Computed Tomography (PET-CT) Scan as a Diagnostic Method in Unknown Primary Tumors
DOC.detailed_description: Patients who fulfill the international definition of unknown primary tumors can be included, except: - Young men (<55 years) with growing mid-line tumors where a germ cell tumor could be expected will not be included. - Patients with lymph-node metastases with squamous cell carcinoma in the head and neck region will not be included. - Women with adenocarcinoma in lymph nodes in the axilla will not be included.
